newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan 3rd qtr aluminium premiums rise five dlrs.
newsitem.headline: Japan 3rd qtr aluminium premiums rise five dlrs.

text.p: Japanese aluminium premiums are being set at $86 to $87 dollars per tonne for deliveries in the July-September quarter, five dollars above the prior quarter's levels, traders said on Friday.
"Some contracts have already settled with a premium of $86/$87 (per tonne)," said one trader at a major trading house.

Several traders said the first deals struck with Australian aluminium suppliers were with a premium of $86 to $87 per tonne, reflecting bullish sentiment among suppliers against a backdrop of strong global demand.
This compares with about $82 per tonne in term contracts for deliveries in the April-June quarter. Most contracts are expected to be finalised by the middle of next week.

Japanese spot aluminium premiums over London Metal Exchange cash prices, a benchmark for northeast Asia, rose over the last several months, lifted by strong domestic demand ahead of Japan's sales tax increase on April 1.

Earlier this week, Japanese traders said spot premiums were about $85/$90, reflecting a strong worldwide appetite for the metal that is evident in low warehouse stocks in London and firm U.S. Midwest premiums.
